body.name: Geeni Freebird Cameras for Home Security, Outdoor Waterproof Cameras, Wireless Camera for Alexa and Google
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 36 mins
features: SMART SECURITY: Monitor your house, driveway, or door, and stream live video right from your phone, or through your Voice Assistant device. Two-way talk lets you communicate without opening the door and stay safe.

SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE: With enhanced infrared night vision, waterproof camera, and motion sensor alarm, the FREEBIRD delivers top-quality surveillance for use as a home surveillance camera, driveway alarm, night vision camera, or door camera.

EASY MAGNETIC MOUNTING: Created with a unique magnetic-mount backing that lets you move and stick just about anywhere wirelessly. Connect to metal surfaces such as gutters quickly and easily. No cables necessary!

LONG-LASTING BATTERY: The powerful 9,000mAh battery is long-lasting and rechargeable via any standard USB power source. Small and powerful, the FREEBIRD wireless camera security system gives you power and control like no other.

NO HUB REQUIRED: Using your home's secure 2.4GHz wifi, you can connect your Geeni FREEBIRD outdoor smart security camera to most Alexa, Google Home, iOS or android devices for full wide angle viewing from the safety of your home.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Smart Wireless Security Camera Advanced Battery-powered Smart Security Put it anywhere for the ultimate protection rain or shine, and see more of what's happening with a wide field of view in 1080p HD.

Previous page Remote 24/7 Access Livestream footage of your home is available 24/7 from anywhere. Motion Alerts When there’s motion, you’ll be notified to view what’s happening in the footage on the Geeni app. Hear & Talk Hear and speak to visitors clearly with 2-way audio right on your smartphone. Day & Night High-quality optics and automatic night vision with crystal clear 1080p HD image capture. Wireless Installation Put it anywhere easily with the magnet, no need to connect your camera to electrical wiring. Next page 1 Control by App 2 Motion Alerts 3 2-Way Audio 4 Night Vision 5 Wireless Installation

View From Any Device Access all Geeni camera views from any desktop or tablet browser. Don't miss a thing Check footage in local memory card (not included) or Geeni cloud storage (free one-month Geeni cloud service, cancel your subscription anytime.)

Previous page One Home. One App. See what more than 10 million users are raving about with 4.8/5 stars. Geeni Smart Security Keep an eye on home even while you're away—check on deliveries, greet visitors & more. Geeni Smart Light Enjoy a brilliant range of colors, advanced lighting effects, brightness control and more. Geeni Smart Power Plug in and control from anywhere—power your appliances on/off or set automated schedules in-app. Smart Pet Feeders Keep your furry friend cared for with our automatic feeder featuring portion control. Next page 1 Why Geeni App? 2 Geeni Security 3 Geeni Light 4 Geeni Power 5 Geeni Pet Feeder

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected
reviews.reviewText: Its one of the few rechargeable options out there with an SD card slot for storage. I prefer the local storage option for both privacy and cost - i.e. no subscription needed. The big selling point is you can mount this anywhere, without needing to run cables!Battery is on pace to last 2mos before needing a charge. (Note: battery life will vary greatly depending on the wifi signal strength where it's mounted, and how often you view the video streams)It's lacking some of the control features you find on other models, such as active zones for motion detection and 24-7 recording etc. however I've found the motion deception to be pretty good at detecting people and ignoring cars that drive by.Overall, pretty happy with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy set up and works well in all weather
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This camera was shipped fast. It was easy and fast to set up and it works fine. I have it out back in front of my dog kennel. I have the motion detector turned off because it does pick up the dogs movement but other than that this is a perfect camera it’s sort of inconspicuous the battery life last for a decent time other than when it’s extremely cold outside but other than that this is a solid piece of equipment, and I will definitely be ordering more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good video quality and viewing angles
reviews.reviewText: I had Blink cameras for a couple of days and decided to return. I already had Geeni smart plugs to help control my bearded dragons’ lights so once I discovered they also made cameras and I could just add them to my existing Geeni app—I was excited to get them. The Geeni cameras have better video quality. You are also able to adjust the viewing angles better because the Geeni Freebird covers a bigger area and has the option of a regular mount and a strong magnetic mount. The magnetic mount has a circular connection which allows you to swivel the angle just right. Wish it came in all black so that it would be more discreet. They were super easy to mount and to connect to wifi/Geeni app. Once powered on, it gave an option so scan a QR to recognize the camera and connect it. I like that the batteries are rechargeable but I don’t think I saw a way to get to them to replace them with regular batteries. Wanted that so that way I don’t have to take the cameras down to recharge. I’ve only had them for a few hours now so we will see how the battery life is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars its okay for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of them. one for my front porch and one for the backyard. not sure why but after 6 months the one in the back has basically became unusable, like there is moisture in the lens or something because you can't see anything. however the other one is great so I think it needs to be in a covered area.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Excited by the potential / Disappointed over-all / Not MY Alexa friendly...
reviews.reviewText: TL;DR: YGWYPF. These units are better than some, but not a solid solution for true security, and if you have to reach out to customer/tech support, you're likely in for a very long and frustrating experience. I think as far as Geeni / Merkury goes, I'll be sticking to smart light bulbs and outlets.So, I've adopted much of the Geeni / Merkury ecosphere. Generally speaking, they're dependable, easy to set up, and quality products at a reasonable price-point. Needing to replace my outdated and now-malfunctioning older exterior cameras, I was excited by the potential of this unit: fully wireless, battery-operated weatherproof HD security camera? Yes, please. Build-quality seemed fine. The unit is beefy, most likely due to the combo of a large battery and a strong magnet. Speaking of the magnet, I was *very* impressed by the ingenuity and strength of the magnetic mounting system: the unit is very stable when mounted this way (but obviously, this mount is not truly secure: someone could easily just grab and make off with the camera, so mounting this way would be more secure if mounted well out of reach to prevent this). It is nice that they also include a screw-on bayonet-style mount as well.The issue is with its connectivity, especially with regards to Amazon Alexa and the Echo Show. I purchased three (3) Echo Show units expressly in order to monitor security from various rooms in my home. While I have no problem monitoring my Geeni Sentinel 1080p indoor camera -via- all my Echo Show devices, as well as in the Geeni app, I have tried repeatedly (including hard resets and reconfigs) to get Amazon Alexa to "see" the Freebird at all, although it IS viewable in the Geeni app on both my phone and tablet. Contacting Geeni customer service (twice) is a frustration measured on a different scale, which wound up necessitating interfacing with the offshore "developers" in Who-Knows-Where-Istan. After supplying the relevant info to them, I haven't heard back from in over a week, and have received zero help since I asked for it, nor remedy.Outside of that issue, in the case of all Geeni cameras, one should be aware that as far as security goes, you're not going to be able to quickly "see" the view from this camera on a wireless display other than your phone through the Geeni app. On an Amazon Echo Show (on a very beefy mesh network, no less) the time it takes for the camera view to populate is between 6-10 seconds. So someone considering this as a true security camera solution should understand that you're not going to get a view of any camera on an Echo Show in the event of a time-sensitive situation (like, say, a trespasser).Pretty disappointed over-all...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Got my hopes up only to be overall disappointed
reviews.reviewText: Pros:Rechargeable/wirelessGreat picture qualityWide viewNight visionGreat mounting hardwareCons:Battery life is short if placed in an area with even medium traffic-I live on a dead end ally with about 8 houses. Battery lasted about 1 week on a full charge.Only records clips-camera only records when there is motion detected, and it's SHORT clips, so you are likely to miss a lot.In order for it to record motion, you have to have notifications turned on, and with them turned on, your phone is going to be pinging constantly if you have even low traffic. When my windchimes move, my phone goes off. I turned the notifications off not knowing that also meant it didn't record ANYTHING.Pulling up the app to view motion sometimes takes so long, the motion that triggered the camera has ended. App is SLOW and glitchy.Overall, camera was not worth the money. I would rather take the steps to install a power outlet and have a constant recording camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Well Made Camera
reviews.reviewText: My freebird camera was recently grabbed off my front porch (I had used the magnet mount). It was thrown down the paved street, I ran outside and found it in 2 pieces. the back cover had popped off but the camera was still working. This was at 11:30pm. 2 cars just missed it. I snapped the rear cover back on and there was a tiny scrape and dent on it. VERY IMPRESSED. I'm still using it today.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I would have gotten this sooner
reviews.reviewText: There is nothing to dislike about this product except maybe a sim card should come with it. I have it mounted and it is doing a fantastic job of alerting and recording( I purchased a sim card to record events) Good item to purchase. Thanks Lydia
Works great, awesome picture. I already use the Geeni wall timers and light bulbs that I use with the app. One of the better cameras I’ve ever had!!

Loved the convenience of moving it around if need be ....not as easy to hook up as stated had to call cable provider and had to seperate 2g from 5 g in order to work ....no sd card so need to purchase it seperate should come with camera .... which i will have to do so for now can watch but cannot record until sd card is purchased grrr !!

reviews.reviewTitle: Unreliable garbagege and terrible customer service
reviews.reviewText: This camera is advertised as having a battery life of up the 3 months, which is probably true, but it does this by sacrificing some critical design choices. The camera does not record constantly, unlike the indoor version, there is no setting to do this, it will only record when the motion sensor is triggered. This is a huge issue, especially considering the motion detection, at best has a massive delay. I have noticed this to be up to 2 seconds, meaning that it takes 2 seconds for the camera to start recording. I have had packages delivered, get the notification there was movement, and when the video is inspected I see the foot of the delivery person leaving through the gate. This is still better than the countless times it simply does not register the movement. I would estimate upwards of 80% of the time it does not register myself coming home and opening the door. Very unreliable and inconsistent, and I will be replacing mine with something else.
